definitions: To go from one side to the other of (something).
To draw a line or lines across (something).
To place (two things) across each other.
To oppose or obstruct (someone or their plans).
To make the sign of the cross over oneself or someone else.
examples: They decided to cross the river.
She will cross her name off the list.
He likes to cross his legs when he sits.
The priest will cross the child.
